paragraphs.name: d8fa
paragraphs.text: But tomorrow never came. The benefits of global trade went, more than 100%, to the super rich. Their transformation from just rich to super rich had less than no benefits for the average person, only costs: at the very same time, the middle class imploded, and life expectancy fell.

490617bcfa20.title: There is a real post-Keynesian economics called modern monetary theory (MMT) that is ready to go.

paragraphs.name: 530c
paragraphs.text: There is a real post-Keynesian economics called modern monetary theory (MMT) that is ready to go. It only has a few universities around the world teaching it but it’s slowly gaining traction. It can solve many economic problems if taught but the groupthink of so many economists makes it incredibly difficult to break.
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modern_Monetary_Theory

paragraphs.name: 64b8
paragraphs.text: There are two fundamental problems associated with the present system of international trade: persistent trade deficits and surpluses, and systemic manipulation of international taxation by multinational corporations. This comment addresses them separately.

paragraphs.text: Not sure why you think that neoliberalism is ignored by the rest of the world when it is the dominant theory taught in all western universities and business schools — to the extent that the students at Manchester Universtity in the UK had to set up their own, ‘Post Crash Club’ to discuss the economics of the 2008 crash because it wasn’t being taught…
